alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 12:39AM PST until December 06 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Stillaguamish River At Arlington affecting Snohomish County. .Heavy rain ended over the area Tuesday. Hydrologically significant rainfall not expected Wednesday. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stillaguamish River at Arlington. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, the Stillaguamish River will cause flooding mainly in the Silvana area, along Norman Road and in Florence. A stage of 17 feet on the Stillaguamish River corresponds roughly to Phase 3 in the Snohomish County Flood program. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:50 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 17.4 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:50 PM PST Tuesday was 21.3 feet around 2 PM Tuesday. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 845 AM PST.
